key_insight: A new sparse omni-voxel (O‑Voxel) representation that natively encodes both geometry and appearance enables learning compact, structured latents from 3D data—improving fidelity for complex topologies while remaining compute- and memory-efficient.
problem_solved: Existing 3D representations struggle to capture complex topologies and fine appearance details without large memory/computation costs, limiting realism and practical deployment of 3D generative models.
method: Introduce O‑Voxel: a sparse, native 3D voxel structure that stores geometry and appearance jointly at voxel-level.
Learn a compact structured latent space directly from native 3D data using O‑Voxels as the encoding substrate, enabling efficient encoding/decoding for generation and reconstruction.
Exploit sparsity and compact parametrization to handle complex topologies and preserve fine detail while reducing memory and compute overhead.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a more expressive and efficient 3D representation for generative modeling, enabling higher-fidelity asset creation and easier deployment for applications like AR/VR, simulation, and content production.
visual_elements: Side-by-side comparison: dense voxels / meshes / point clouds vs. O‑Voxel showcasing topology/detail retention
Annotated O‑Voxel cell diagram showing geometry + appearance channels and sparsity mask
Pipeline diagram: native 3D data → O‑Voxel encoder → compact structured latent → decoder/generator
Reconstruction and interpolation examples highlighting preserved complex topology and appearance
paper_title: Native and Compact Structured Latents for 3D Generation
paper_authors: Jianfeng Xiang, Xiaoxue Chen, Sicheng Xu, Ruicheng Wang, Zelong Lv
